column4: I have bought a nvidia 8500GT graphic card,but how can I get it work?
using that one,I cannot use compiz

install envy, start it from the main menu under 'system' and install the nvidia proprietary drivers. Then install nvidia-settings and start it with 'sudo nvidia-settings' from the terminal, make all changes, save them to the xorg.conf file by clicking the button there and things should be set up. Also think about having a look at the ubuntu wiki
You do not appear to be using the NVIDIA X driver. Please edit your X configuration file (just run `nvidia-xconfig` as root), and restart the X server.
did you install the driver using envy?
but only installed without do anything else
without anything else means you installed envy, said install and then it should have asked you, if you want it to configure the drivers, did you do that?
I use envy ,installed the drivers for nvdia
at what point did you get the error message you posted?
while I attemp to use some visual effects
you'd help me a lot if you'd be more specific with your answers
did envy aks you to configure the drivers for you?
try 'sudo nvidia-xconfig' and restart with ctrl+alt+backspace
